questions.question: Whose bag is this? It is …………………………
questions.description: Mine is a possessive pronoun it is used alone. My is a possessive adjective. It is followed by a noun.

questions.question: He patted ………………………. on the back.
questions.description: When the subject and object refer to the same person, use the reflexive pronoun.

questions.question: Each one of .............................. narrated their own version of the story.
questions.description: Use an object pronoun after a preposition.

questions.question: She asked me what ………………………… problem was.
questions.description: We use the possessive adjective my to modify the noun problem here.

questions.question: That child of ……………………………. has broken my window.
They elected …………………………. their leader.
questions.description: A pronoun used as the object of a verb should be in its object form.

questions.question: I waited for ………………………… but they didn’t come.
questions.description: A pronoun used as the object of  preposition should be in its object form.

questions.question: She is taller than ……………………………. is.
questions.description: A pronoun used as the subject of a verb should be in its subject form.

questions.question: I don’t want to go with ………………………………
Be careful or you will injure ……………………………
questions.description: When the subject and object refer to the same person, use the reflexive pronoun.

questions.question: You are no better than ………………………….
questions.description: Object pronouns are more common after than and as.
